current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
For the relief of Joseph Gabra and Sharon
		  Kamel.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any other provision of law, for the
			 purposes of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, Joseph
			 Gabra and Sharon Kamel shall each be deemed to have been lawfully admitted to,
			 and remained in, the United States, and shall be eligible for adjustment of
			 status to that of an alien lawfully admitted for permanent residence under

upon filing
			 an application for such adjustment of status.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 245 of the Immigration and Nationality Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall apply only if the
			 application for adjustment of status is filed with appropriate fees not later
			 than 2 years after the date of the enactment of this Act.

text.#text:
Upon the granting of permanent resident
			 status to Joseph Gabra and Sharon Kamel, the Secretary of State shall instruct
			 the proper officer to reduce by 2, during the current or subsequent fiscal
			 year, the total number of immigrant visas that are made available to natives of
			 the country of birth of Joseph Gabra and Sharon Kamel under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or, if applicable, the
			 total number of immigrant visas that are made available to natives of the
			 country of birth of Joseph Gabra and Sharon Kamel under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 203(a) of
			 the Immigration and Nationality Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall be determined by reference to the latest
			 statement titled

, provided that such statement has been submitted prior
			 to the vote on passage.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Chairman of the
			 Senate Budget Committee
